intro: Gilia congesta var. paniculata, commonly known as the panicled gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, with five petals and stamens that are often more numerous than the petals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
